page.title: 18Recreation (3)
page.content: Some of the paths are bridleways , and increasing prosperity means that , even in a motor age more people are taking to horse-riding for pleasure . But at Merdon Manor the stables have been converted to garages ; Mr.Smith has horses , but they are for breeding and kept at his stud farm elsewhere . Other forms of exercise are popular too , and the quiet lanes of the area are used by cyclists and even joggers from Winchester . Perhaps this is part of a general trend towards more exercise as entertainment - Merdon Manor now has an indoor swimming pool but the billiard room has gone .
